Swipe.title: Swipe
Swipe.description: Represents a user's swipe action on another user.

swipeId.description: Unique identifier for the swipe event.

swiperId.description: Reference to the user who initiated the swipe. (Relationship: User 1:N Swipe)

targetId.description: Reference to the user who was swiped upon. (Relationship: User 1:N Swipe)

Match.title: Match
Match.description: Represents a match between two users.

matchId.description: Unique identifier for the match (e.g., userA_userB to ensure uniqueness).

users.description: An array containing the IDs of the two matched users.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the match was created.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a conversation between two matched users.

matchId.description: Reference to the Match entity. (Relationship: Match 1:1 Conversation)

users.description: An array containing the IDs of the users participating in the conversation.

lastMessage.description: The content of the last message sent in the conversation.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the conversation was last updated (e.g., new message sent).

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a single message within a conversation.

senderId.description: Reference to the user who sent the message. (Relationship: User 1:N Message)

content.description: The text content of the message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support a mutual matching system with secure conversations. It prioritizes authorization independence and clear security rules.

*   `/swipes/{swipeId}`: Stores swipe data. Security rules will ensure only authenticated users can create swipes.
*   `/matches/{matchId}`: Stores match data, created by a Cloud Function.  The `matchId` is deterministic to prevent duplicates. Clients cannot directly write here, ensuring matches are only created when mutual swipes occur.
*   `/conversations/{matchId}`: Stores conversation metadata. Clients cannot write here directly; a Cloud Function manages creation and updates based on messages. The `users` array is denormalized here for efficient querying and security rule enforcement. Security rules ensure only users within the `users` array can read or write to the conversation.
*   `/conversations/{matchId}/messages/{messageId}`: Stores individual messages within a conversation. Security rules ensure that only users participating in the conversation can read or write messages.

**Authorization Independence & QAPs:**

Authorization independence is achieved by storing the `users` array (member list) directly within the `conversations` document. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules to verify user membership, enabling atomic operations. This structure also supports the required QAPs (Rules are not Filters) because list operations on `/conversations/{matchId}/messages` can be secured by directly checking the `request.auth.uid` against the `users` array in the parent `conversation` document, without needing to filter based on message content or sender.
